docs.title: 🛩️ Welcome to OpenFlightPlan
docs.text:
OpenFlightPlan is a free, mobile-first mission planning tool designed for creating 2D orthomosaics and 3D modeling flight grids — right from your browser.

Unlike expensive tools like Dronelink or Pix4D, OpenFlightPlan offers:

  • 📱 Full mobile optimization
  • 🔓 All advanced flight parameters unlocked for free
  • 💾 Download-ready CSV and KMZ flight plans
  • 🚫 No accounts required to use

Whether you're mapping fields, buildings, or construction sites — plan, generate, and export your drone missions in minutes, even from your phone.

docs.title: 🚀 Why OpenFlightPlan?
docs.text:
• Mission planning without a laptop
  • Designed for fieldwork — pull over, plan, and fly
  • No hidden costs — all features are free
  • Powerful tools — overlap, speed, altitude, field of view settings
  • Open-source — contribute or self-host if you want

docs.title: 🚀 Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome to OpenFlightPlan. Follow these simple steps to generate your first flight plan.

docs.title: Step 1: Access the App
docs.text: Visit openflightplan.io ✅ No download needed.

docs.title: Step 2: Define Your Area
docs.text:
• Use the drawing tools to outline your area of interest (AOI) directly on the map.
  • OpenFlightPlan automatically calculates the center coordinates and area size.

docs.title: Step 3: Set Parameters
docs.text: Customize your flight: - Altitude (meters or feet) - Speed (m/s or mph) - Front overlap and sidelap - Camera settings (interval, FOV)

docs.title: Step 4: Generate the Flight Plan
docs.text:
Choose the direction: - North-South - East-West

Click Generate to build your waypoints.

docs.title: Step 5: Download and Fly
docs.text:
• Export your grid as CSV or KMZ
  • Load into your preferred flight app
  • Launch your mission!

docs.title: ✏️ Using the App
docs.text: Learn the ins and outs of OpenFlightPlan.

docs.title: 🗺️ Drawing Your Area
docs.text:
• Tap the map to draw polygons or rectangles.
  • Your AOI (Area of Interest) automatically calculates dimensions.

docs.title: ⚙️ Setting Flight Parameters
docs.text:
Fine-tune your settings:

Parameter Description Altitude Height of flight grid Speed Drone travel speed Overlap Image overlap for stitching Sidelap Side-to-side overlap Interval Camera trigger interval FOV Field of view of camera

docs.title: 📥 Export Options
docs.text:
• CSV: Grid waypoints (latitude, longitude)
  • KMZ: Google Earth-friendly mission overlays
